column4: My xubuntu desktop keeps sending about 10kbps to the internet and I don't know why.
e.g. "sudo ping google.de" and yes, paste here
What does that second line mean?
are you sure with the 10kbps? where did you test it?
I'm looking aht the graph the system monitor shows me.
are you sure that you look right?
I'm not doing anything. My card is sending data at 13kpbs and my router is blinking a lot.
you could find out which data is sending over the router, or you could eject the cable (power) from the router for a minute
How do I do the first thing? how would the second thing help me?
dont know, with a program which shows the network traffic, and the 2. could be not a problem of your pc, or? it could be a problem of the router
no, when I turn this pc off and work with my laptop everything is fine.
and if you turn on the pc, other pcs got a slow internet connection?
no becuase it only uses 10kpbs, i have a pretty fast connection.
